meanings.definition: To shape or form in advance.
meanings.sent1: She likes to preshape the dough before baking cookies.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor decided to preshape the clay before starting the actual sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally preshaped the bread dough into a funny animal shape.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude seemed to preshape the outcome of the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance helped preshape the students' understanding of the topic.

meanings.sent1: The preshape of the cake looked like a simple circle.
meanings.sent2: Before starting the project, they discussed the preshape of the design.
meanings.sent3: The preshape of the cloud resembled a fluffy bunny.
meanings.sent4: The preshape of the puzzle pieces hinted at the final image.
meanings.sent5: The preshape of the building gave a glimpse of its grandeur.
